_values:
Prior to
OpenSSL 1.1.1, it was common for applications to store
information about the state of the random-number generator
in a file that was loaded at startup and rewritten upon
exit. On modern operating systems, this is generally no
longer necessary as OpenSSL will seed itself from a trusted
entropy source provided by the operating system. The

flags are still supported
for special platforms or circumstances that might require
them.

It is generally
an error to use the same seed file more than once and every
use of
